alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:11PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Lucie, eastern Okeechobee, southeastern Indian River and Martin Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 210 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Queens Cove to 10 miles southeast of Fort Drum to 9 miles southwest of J And S Fish Camp. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Sebastian and Stuart. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. On rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
